column1: Andrews Tarn and Andrews Glacier Trail
column7: Partly cloudy skies. A stray shower or thunderstorm is possible. High 71F. Winds W at 5 to 10 mph.
column8: Partly cloudy early. Scattered thunderstorms developing in the afternoon. High 69F. Winds W at 5 to 10 mph. Chance of rain 50%.
column19: Beautiful day. Very few people after leaving main trail. Trail leading up to the tarn is challenging but well cairned. Fantastic view after leaving trees. One can probably climb the glacier with just spikes and poles but ice axe is good to have. After reaching the top of glacier, choose the route of least resistance to reach Taylor Peak summit. Unbelievable view of Sky Pond, Longs and surrounding peaks from top of Taylor. Glissading down the glacier was also tons of fun. All in all a great day in the park

column19: Left a car at lower lost man and drove to start hike at upper. Was a beautiful day. Lots of water crossings but nothing without rocks or logs so did not get wet. Very windy at top of saddle but fantastic views in every direction. Highly recommend as long as you account for weather. We were outside almost 6 hours but “moving” 4.5 hours. Stopped to take lots of photos and also for lunch…

column19:
hiked on sunday 7/17. 
Road was blocked at Nederland High school. The rangers told us we would have to wait in line for cars to come down before heading up to the trailhead. We got in line around 10am with 5 cars in front of us, and we were allowed to start driving up to the 4th of July Trailhead at 10:30. 
If you're not getting to the trailhead super early, be prepared to stop and wait for parking. The rangers/volunteers are extremely nice and helpful, they are doing a fantastic job!

There's an awesome field of wildflowers about 1/2 mile heading up to the upper lake from Diamond Lake that's worth going to. Snow is present at the Upper Diamond Lake but nothing needing snowshoes or crampons. No snow between the trailhead to Diamond Lake but lots of water crossings - bring waterproof shoes.

column19: Summited Maroon Peak on 7/15. Started around 4:30 am from Crater Lake and summited around 9:30 am. It was a long and brutal hike up once the elevation started gaining. Once we gained the ridge it was a fun and adrenaline rushing experience to the top. The route finding was fairly tough and the technical class 3 sections were fun. Finished back at crater lake around 1:30pm. Some snow along the side of one main gulley but completely avoidable. Other than that it is perfect summer conditions! Aiming to do capitol peak on 7/30 if anyone is interested in joining forces!
